title: Consider 2 MySQL Servers for replication setup, one is a Master and the other is a Slave.

inline_content.Text: Consider 2 MySQL Servers for replication setup, one is a Master and the other is a Slave.

title: We are going to configure the Master that it should keep a log of every action performed on it. We are going to configure the Slave server that it should look at the log on the Master and whenever changes happens in log on the Master, it should do the same thing.

inline_content.Text: We are going to configure the Master that it should keep a log of every action performed on it. We are going to configure the Slave server that it should look at the log on the Master and whenever changes happens in log on the Master, it should do the same thing.

title: First of all, we need to create a user on the Master. This user is going to be used by Slave to create a connection with the Master.

inline_content.Text: First of all, we need to create a user on the Master. This user is going to be used by Slave to create a connection with the Master.

title: Change
user_name
c
and
user_password
c
according to your Username and Password.

inline_content.Text: according to your Username and Password.

title: Now
my.inf
c
(my.cnf in Linux) file should be edited. Include the following lines in [mysqld] section.

inline_content.Text: (my.cnf in Linux) file should be edited. Include the following lines in [mysqld] section.

title: The first line is used to assign an ID to this MySQL server.

inline_content.Text: The first line is used to assign an ID to this MySQL server.

title: The second line tells MySQL to start writing a log in the specified log file. In Linux this can be configured like
log-bin = /home/mysql/logs/mysql-bin.log
c
. If you are starting replication in a MySQL server in which replication has already been used, make sure this directory is empty of all replication logs.

inline_content.Text: The second line tells MySQL to start writing a log in the specified log file. In Linux this can be configured like
. If you are starting replication in a MySQL server in which replication has already been used, make sure this directory is empty of all replication logs.

title: The third line is used to configure the database for which we are going to write log. You should replace
your_database
c
with your database name.

inline_content.Text: The third line is used to configure the database for which we are going to write log. You should replace

title: Make sure
skip-networking
c
has not been enabled and restart the MySQL server(Master)

inline_content.Text: has not been enabled and restart the MySQL server(Master)

title: my.inf
c
file should be edited in Slave also. Include the following lines in [mysqld] section.

inline_content.Text: file should be edited in Slave also. Include the following lines in [mysqld] section.

title:
server-id = 2
master-host = master_ip_address
master-connect-retry = 60

master-user = user_name
master-password = user_password
replicate-do-db = your_database

relay-log = slave-relay.log
relay-log-index = slave-relay-log.index

content_resolved.code:
server-id = 2
master-host = master_ip_address
master-connect-retry = 60

master-user = user_name
master-password = user_password
replicate-do-db = your_database

relay-log = slave-relay.log
relay-log-index = slave-relay-log.index

title: The first line is used to assign an ID to this MySQL server. This ID should be unique.

inline_content.Text: The first line is used to assign an ID to this MySQL server. This ID should be unique.

title: The second line is the I.P address of the Master server. Change this according to your Master system I.P.

inline_content.Text: The second line is the I.P address of the Master server. Change this according to your Master system I.P.

title: The third line is used to set a retry limit in seconds.

inline_content.Text: The third line is used to set a retry limit in seconds.

title: The next two lines tell the username and password to the Slave, by using which it connect the Master.

inline_content.Text: The next two lines tell the username and password to the Slave, by using which it connect the Master.

title: Next line set the database it needs to replicate.

inline_content.Text: Next line set the database it needs to replicate.

title: The last two lines used to assign
relay-log
c
and
relay-log-index
c
file names.

inline_content.Text: The last two lines used to assign

title: Make sure
skip-networking
c
has not been enabled and restart the MySQL server(Slave)

inline_content.Text: has not been enabled and restart the MySQL server(Slave)

title: If data is constantly being added to the Master, we will have to prevent all database access on the Master so nothing can be added. This can be achieved by run the following statement in Master.

inline_content.Text: If data is constantly being added to the Master, we will have to prevent all database access on the Master so nothing can be added. This can be achieved by run the following statement in Master.

title: If no data is being added to the server, you can skip the above step.

inline_content.Text: If no data is being added to the server, you can skip the above step.

title: Now we have to import backup into Slave MySQL server.

inline_content.Text: Now we have to import backup into Slave MySQL server.

title:
mysql -u root -p your_database  <D://Backup/backup.sql
--->Change `your_database` and backup directory according to your setup

mysql -u root -p your_database  <D://Backup/backup.sql
--->Change `your_database` and backup directory according to your setup

c

SHOW MASTER STATUS
c

title: Now the Master keep a log for every action performed on it and the Slave server look at the log on the Master. Whenever changes happens in log on the Master, Slave replicate that.

inline_content.Text: Now the Master keep a log for every action performed on it and the Slave server look at the log on the Master. Whenever changes happens in log on the Master, Slave replicate that.
